column4: qŭóniam in te confídit ánima mea. Et in ùmbra alárum tuárum sperábo
column5: donec tránsiat iníqŭitas. ^ Have mercy on me
column8: for my soul trusteth in thee. And in the shadow of thy wings will I hope

column2: Deum qŭi benefécit mìhi. ^ I will cry to God the most high
column3: to God who hath done good to me.

column2: et liberávit me~; dèdit in oppróbrium conculcántes me. Misit Deus misericórdiam suam et veritátem suam
column3: ^ He hath sent from heaven and delivered me~; he gave over to reproach them that trod upon me. God hath sent his mercy and his truth

column1: 5 ^ et erìpuit ánimam meam de mèdio catulórum leónum. Dormívi conturbátus. Fílii hòminum dentes eórum arma et sagìttaĕ
column2: et lingŭa eórum gládius acútus. ^ and he hath delivered my soul from the midst of the young lions. I slept troubled. The sons of men
column3: whose teeth are weapons and arrows
column4: and their tongue a sharp sword.

column3: et in omnem terram glória tua. ^ Be thou exalted
column6: and to all the earth thy glory.

column2: et incurvavérunt ánimam meam. Fodérunt ante fáciem meam fóveam
column3: et incidérunt in eam. ^ They prepared a snare for my feet
column4: and they bowed down my soul. They dug a pit before my face
column5: and they are fallen into it.

column3: parátum cor meum~; cantábo et psalmum dicem. ^ My heart is ready
column5: my heart is ready~; I will sing

column3: psaltérium et cìttara~; exsùrgem dilúculo. ^ Arise
column5: arise psaltery and harp~; I will arise early.

column3: et psalmum dicem tìbi in gèntibus
column4: ^ I will give praise to thee among the people
column6: and I will sing a psalm to thee among the nations

column1: 11 ^ qŭóniam magnificáta est usqŭe ad caĕlos misericórdia tua
column2: et usqŭe ad nubes vèritas tua. ^ for thy mercy is magnified even to the heavens
column3: and thy truth unto the clouds.
et super omnem terram glória tua. ^ Be thou exalted
column6: and thy glory above all the earth.
